image.altText: Portrait photo of suspected murder victim Phyllis Harrison.

props.synopsis: A man accused of killing three people over 13 years allegedly had a "thing" for knives and told two people he had stabbed an "old lady", a court has heard.

title.children: Former prison mate tells court alleged serial killer 'stabbed' woman and threw knife in bushes

image.altText: Australian flag on a pole outside the Melbourne Shrine of Remembrance

props.synopsis: The City of Unley reverses its decision to hold Australia Day citizenship and awards ceremonies on January 25 after the council conducted a survey that found a majority of residents supported celebrating the events on the public holiday.

title.children: Council reverses its decision to move Australia Day events away from public holiday

image.altText: Close up of sign saying Unley Oval

props.synopsis: The City of Unley announces findings from a public survey about a controversial fence that has created division in an inner-south community of Adelaide.

title.children: Council to create concept design for Unley Oval fence but maintains no decision has been made

image.altText: Green and red table grapes from the United States, $19.99 and $21.99 per kilo.

props.synopsis: If you have baulked at the price of table grapes at the supermarket lately the good news is they could drop by up to $10/kg when the Australian season brings locally-grown produce to the shelves.

title.children: Eyewatering supermarket grape prices expected to drop dramatically as local season approaches

image.altText: An SA Police vehicle with flashing lights.

props.synopsis: SA Police charges a 20-year-old disability worker with dangerous driving following a fatal crash at Hayborough, south of Adelaide on Sunday that killed a woman using a wheelchair.

title.children: Disability worker charged after fatal crash south of Adelaide

image.altText: Reserve Bank of Australia generic

props.synopsis: The decision followed last week's call by the US Federal Reserve to cut rates by a hefty 0.5 percentage points in the United States.

title.children: Reserve Bank keeps interest rates on hold at 4.35pc, ignoring political pressure for cut

image.altText: Side view close-up of pregnant woman touching her belly

props.synopsis: People who want to terminate their pregnancy after 28 weeks would be required to deliver their baby alive if a push by a conservative Liberal to change South Australian abortion laws succeed.

title.children: MP pushes for live births over abortions in proposed SA law changes

image.altText: A close up of a black and white dairy cow

props.synopsis: About 22 farmers and 159 workers at the company's Jervois and Murray Bridge sites will be affected by the development.

title.children: SA dairy Beston Global Food Company goes into voluntary administration

image.altText: Suzanne Armstrong and Susan Bartlett were housemates in Collingwood in 1977.

props.synopsis: Over the weekend Perry Kouroumblis was arrested in Rome in connection to the 1977 Easey Street murders. It was news that left his friend Phil Akers 'dumbfounded'.

title.children: Friend 'dumbfounded' by arrest of Perry Kouroumblis over Easey Street murders

image.altText: Palmer pic

props.synopsis: The federal government is close to announcing an electoral reform proposal likely to provoke teal independents and trigger a legal challenge from Clive Palmer.

title.children: Government sets crosshairs on 'billionaire' political donors, including teal backers

image.altText: A man wearing a baseball cap and blue jacket stands in front of a car with L plates

props.synopsis: The South Australian government is proposing changes to driver training laws, but some private driving instructors say the reforms could leave people with disability behind.

title.children: SA driving instructors say new laws will make it harder for people with disability to get their licence

image.altText: man and woman on farm smile to camera holding a plant

props.synopsis: Some would say South Australia is too cold for the tropical agave plant, but one couple hopes to disprove that theory with the country's second-ever commercial agave planting.

title.children: Wine grape growers looking to diversify plant agave tequila crops in SA

image.altText: a group of soldiers wearing camouflage stepping from the shore onto a beach

props.synopsis: As US military presence ramps up in the north, experts say one of Australia's closest Asian neighbours is growing wary that the US's expanded presence could bring rising tensions to the region.

title.children: Growing US military build-up in Australia's north concerning Indonesia

image.altText: a woman in a white suit in the House of Reps smiling

props.synopsis: The federal government says the extensions will secure the jobs of more than 1,800 workers, but the move has angered environmentalists who have described the decision as "the opposite of climate action".

title.children: Three NSW coal mines to be extended for another 30 to 40 years after federal government approval

image.altText: Smoke billows over southern Lebanon

props.synopsis: After almost a year of war against Hamas in Gaza on its southern border, Israel is shifting its focus to its northern frontier.

title.children: Israel and Hezbollah exchange fire after Lebanon suffers huge casualties

image.altText: Smoke rises behind residential buildings

props.synopsis: Hezbollah's goal to deter Israel from further conflict has failed, but unless it is critically weakened, the attacks on Lebanon may not achieve what Israel wants.

title.children: Hezbollah was trying to avoid a large Israeli offensive, but now it probably won't back down

image.altText: A middle-aged Kurdish woman smiles at the camera in a posed but informal portrait shot.

props.synopsis: A friend of Cigdem Aslan says any suggestion she was conducting activities for a banned Kurdish separatist group are a "100 per cent lie".

title.children: Friend denies Melbourne woman arrested in Türkiye has any connection to terrorism

image.altText: Uluru waterfalls

props.synopsis: A rare spring northwest cloudband delivers record rain to parts of outback Australia. The weather event is now moving southeast towards Sydney.

title.children: Rain records broken near Uluru as major cloudband moves towards eastern states

image.altText: A generic image of two NT Police officers at work on the streets.

props.synopsis: New details of a human rights complaint lodged on behalf of Aboriginal NT police officers have emerged, alleging 'countless' examples of racism by non-Indigenous members of the force.

title.children: Aboriginal NT police officers detail allegations of 'racist culture' in human rights complaint

image.altText: A police officer wearing a dark uniform and yellow vest stands beside police tape and a sign saying "Welcome to The Grove."

props.synopsis: A 16-year-old boy is dead and a 15-year-old has been arrested after an alleged fight in front of a school holiday lunch crowd in Melton.

title.children: Teenage boy allegedly stabbed to death in front of lunchtime crowd at Melbourne shopping centre

image.altText: A smiling blond woman

props.synopsis: Police have renewed their search in the case of missing Ballarat woman Samantha Murphy, with efforts set to continue on Wednesday.

title.children: Police launch fresh search in case of missing Ballarat woman Samantha Murphy

image.altText: Signs at coles and woolworths

props.synopsis: Regular customers, fed up with Coles and Woolworths' marketing tactics, have set off a chain of events that have seen Australia's biggest grocers dragged before the courts.

title.children: Why it took people power to bring Australia's two biggest supermarkets to court

image.altText: Composite of Ryan Routh taking a selfie and Thomas Matthew Crooks school photo

props.synopsis: One alleged assassin now sits in a detention centre.The other is dead, leaving a mystery behind.

title.children: Two men have allegedly attempted to assassinate Donald Trump. One of them remains a mystery

image.altText: A woman in yellow jumper holding shopping bag faces a supermarket shelf full of colourful wrapped foods.

props.synopsis: Australians are experiencing the most drawn-out period of economic misery for more than a decade, according to new research.

title.children: Australians are experiencing more economic 'misery' than they have since 2011, new research says

image.altText: A man is pictured from behind.

props.synopsis: The credibility of the Albanese government's much vaunted wagering self-exclusion scheme BetStop has been called into question after loopholes in the system allowed a Sydney man to lose nearly $70,000 despite signing up to a lifetime ban.

title.children: BetStop was supposed to protect gambling addicts, but it didn't stop Ravi from losing nearly $70,000

image.altText: Tony Armstrong wearing a white T shirt and a denim jacket.

props.synopsis: Popular ABC presenter and Gold Logie nominee Tony Armstrong announces he will leave ABC News Breakfast in October. Tony will return to ABC screens in 2025 hosting a new show to be announced later.

title.children: Tony Armstrong announces departure from ABC News Breakfast to host new show

image.altText: Colin Kinner, who has short brown hair and is wearing a blue collared shirt, poses for a photo next to a window

props.synopsis: A free online course aims to bust COVID misinformation and teach people how to stop the virus spreading in schools. But perhaps its greatest challenge is engaging people in the first place — particularly those who believe COVID is harmless.

title.children: Schools don't have to be hotbeds of COVID. One dad is fighting back with facts

image.altText: Hannah sitting in the sun smiling with a drink in hand.

props.synopsis: Lachlan Morganti gambled the GoFundMe money away over five days with the intention to recoup losses from other gambling debts, the court heard.

title.children: Man pleads guilty to stealing more than $60k from fundraiser for allegedly murdered woman's family

image.altText: Bri Lee 2024

props.synopsis: The author and journalist speaks about the fork in the road that changed her life, and why she had to step away from sexual assault advocacy.

title.children: For years, Bri Lee was a law graduate dealing with sexual assault. The next move she made was 'out of self-protection'

image.altText: ADFA cadets unidentifiable

props.synopsis: After one day of deliberations an ACT Supreme Court jury finds former army officer cadet Jake Sullivan, 24, guilty of raping a fellow cadet after the two agreed to meet up for sex in March 2022.

title.children: ACT jury finds former army officer cadet guilty of rape

image.altText: Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory

props.synopsis: A former student teacher tells the ACT Supreme Court she sent explicit images of herself to a 15-year-old boy she met while on a teaching placement because he was "very persistent and pushy" as she faces charges including persistent sexual abuse of a child.

title.children: Former Canberra student teacher sent 15-year-old explicit images because he was 'persistent and pushy', court hears

image.altText: An illustration of a man dreaming of sleep-tracking wearables

props.synopsis: Sleep-tracking has boomed in popularity worldwide, giving researchers access to millions of hours of sleep data. When a natural disaster hits or a COVID variant spreads, they see the impact in our sleep.

title.children: Popular sleep-tracking has wired the world for study. Now the first results are in

image.altText: a man in police uniform

props.synopsis: Steve Gollschewski says he has ordered that no records be destroyed as Queensland Police Service combs its archives to share with the inquiry.

title.children: Queensland police commissioner says records of notorious Native Police will be shared with truth-telling inquiry

image.altText: swans swim on a lake at sunrise

props.synopsis: Beloved native swans are particularly susceptible to a deadly strain of bird flu, according to scientists who fear for native birds if the virus hits Australian shores.

title.children: Black swan extinction possible if deadly bird flu strain arrives in Australia

image.altText: A close up side-on shot of a brown baby penguin.

props.synopsis: At just nine months of age, Pesto is already far bigger than the adult king penguins at Melbourne's aquarium.

title.children: Calm, curious and can eat eight fish at a time — meet Pesto the Penguin
